paper_metadata.title: Germline Variants of Prostate Cancer in Japanese Families
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper reports several variants in the BRCA2 gene associated with prostate cancer in Japanese families, including their clinical significance and penetrance data.

patients.phenotype: Prostate cancer, family history of breast and esophageal cancer

individual_records.phenotype_details: Prostate cancer, family history of breast cancer
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The BRCA2 variant (V2109I) was found in a patient with breast cancer (BC) with family history of pancreas cancer.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Prostate cancer, family history of esophageal cancer
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The BRCA2 variant (V2109I) was found in a patient with esophageal cancer with family history of gastric cardia cancer.

functional_data.summary: The variant is classified as a variant of uncertain significance (VUS) and requires further evidence for pathogenicity.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the families.
variants.additional_notes: The variant was found in patients with a family history of other cancers, indicating potential multi-cancer susceptibility.
key_quotes: The BRCA2 variant (V2109I) was found in a patient with breast cancer (BC) with family history of pancreas cancer.
The BRCA2 variant (V2109I) was found in a patient with esophageal cancer with family history of gastric cardia cancer.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding BRCA2 variants were extracted from the main text.
